name: Text-Grab
description: Use OCR in Windows quickly and easily with Text Grab. With optional background process and notifications.
readme_summary: Text Grab is a C# Windows utility that uses Optical Character Recognition (OCR) to extract and copy text from any visible content on the screen. It leverages the Windows API for local OCR processing, offering multiple modes for flexible text capture without requiring a constant background process.
key_features: Optical Character Recognition (OCR) for screen text
Local OCR processing via Windows API
Copy text to clipboard
Full-Screen Grab Mode (select region or click word)
Grab Frame Mode (transparent overlay with search)
Minimal UI and no constant background process
Installable via Microsoft Store, GitHub Releases, Scoop, and Chocolatey
primary_use_case: Quickly and easily copying text from any visible source on a Windows screen, including images, videos, or application elements where text is not selectable.
cover_image_prompt: A magical magnifying glass hovering over a computer screen displaying various elements like a screenshot, a video frame, and an application window. As the magnifying glass passes over these elements, the text within them detaches and floats upwards as glowing, selectable letters, forming a stream that flows into a digital clipboard icon. Subtle UI elements of the 'Text Grab' application are visible on the screen's edge. The overall scene is bright and modern, rendered in a clean, 3D isometric illustration style with a focus on clarity and the transformation of visual text into digital copy.

name: HuggingFaceModelDownloader
description: Simple go utility to download HuggingFace Models and Datasets
readme_summary: HuggingFaceModelDownloader is a Go utility designed for efficiently downloading models and datasets from the Hugging Face Hub. It offers features like resumable and multipart downloads, a user-friendly TUI and Web UI, and a Go library for programmatic integration.
key_features: Resumable downloads with SHA-256 and size-based verification
Multipart parallel downloads with up to 16 connections per file
Simultaneous download of multiple files
Colorful terminal UI (TUI) with progress bars
Web-based dashboard for managing downloads
Support for downloading models and datasets
Filtering by quantization levels (e.g., q4_0, q5_k_m)
Authentication for private repositories and gated models
Go library with a full API for programmatic use
WebSocket and REST API for real-time updates and integrations
primary_use_case: Downloading models and datasets from the Hugging Face Hub with enhanced speed, reliability, and user interface options.
cover_image_prompt: A stylized, friendly robot arm in a clean, modern workshop, efficiently grabbing large, colorful building blocks labeled 'Models' and 'Datasets' from a vast digital cloud labeled 'Hugging Face Hub'. The robot arm is shown in multiple positions simultaneously, representing parallel and resumable downloads, with data streams flowing rapidly and securely into a neatly organized storage container. Subtle glowing UI elements and progress bars are integrated into the robot's design, hinting at the tool's interface. The overall mood is one of speed, reliability, and ease of use, rendered in a vibrant 3D isometric illustration style with a bright, optimistic color palette.

name: abogen
description: Generate audiobooks from EPUBs, PDFs and text with synchronized captions.
readme_summary: Abogen is a Python-based tool that converts various document formats (EPUB, PDF, text, markdown, subtitles) into audiobooks with synchronized captions. It utilizes the Kokoro-82M model for natural-sounding text-to-speech and can be used for creating audio content for platforms like Instagram, YouTube, and TikTok.
key_features: Converts EPUB, PDF, text, markdown, and subtitle files to audio.
Generates synchronized captions for the audio.
Uses the Kokoro-82M model for high-quality text-to-speech.
Supports installation via script (Windows) or uv (with CUDA support for NVIDIA GPUs).
Cross-platform compatibility (Windows, Linux, macOS).
primary_use_case: Generating audiobooks and voiceovers from text-based documents with synchronized captions.
cover_image_prompt: A wise, old librarian is meticulously transforming stacks of dusty books (EPUBs, PDFs, and text documents) into a vibrant, flowing river of sound waves. As the sound waves emanate, they coalesce into glowing, synchronized captions that gently float alongside. The librarian uses a magical quill that glows with digital energy, symbolizing the text-to-speech conversion. In the background, subtle screens display waveform visualizations and the 'abogen' logo. The scene is set in a cozy, modern library with warm, inviting lighting, rendered in a 3D isometric illustration style with clean lines and a rich, warm color palette.

name: holehe
description: holehe allows you to check if the mail is used on different sites like twitter, instagram and will retrieve information on sites with the forgotten password function.
readme_summary: Holehe is a Python tool designed to check if an email address is registered on a wide variety of websites. It leverages the 'forgotten password' functionality of these sites to discreetly gather this information without alerting the user.
key_features: Checks email registration status on over 120 websites
Utilizes forgotten password function to avoid detection
Provides information on account existence, and sometimes partial recovery details
Can be used via CLI or embedded in Python applications
Supports asynchronous operations with Trio and httpx
primary_use_case: Information gathering and OSINT by checking email account existence across multiple online platforms.
cover_image_prompt: A digital detective, represented by a magnifying glass with a glowing circuit board pattern, is sifting through a stream of digital envelopes, each labeled with an email address. The magnifying glass hovers over specific envelopes, causing them to illuminate and reveal small, stylized icons of popular social media and e-commerce sites (like Twitter, Instagram, eBay). In the background, a subtle, abstract network of data flows, with the name 'Holehe' subtly integrated into the network's nodes. The overall mood is one of focused investigation and discovery, with a clean, modern aesthetic. The style should be a 3D isometric illustration with a cool, blue and green color palette, emphasizing clarity and digital information.

name: TLG_JoinCaptchaBot
description: Telegram Bot to verify if users joining a group are human. The Bot sends an image captcha to each new user and removes those who fail to solve it within a specified time.
readme_summary: TLG_JoinCaptchaBot is a Python-based Telegram bot that automatically verifies new users joining a group by presenting them with an image CAPTCHA. It removes users who fail to solve the challenge within a time limit and also combats spam by deleting messages with URLs from unverified users.
key_features: Automatic CAPTCHA challenges for new users
User removal for failed CAPTCHA attempts
Time limit for CAPTCHA solving
Anti-spam by deleting URL messages from unverified users
Support for multiple languages (localization)
Deployment options via Systemd or Docker
primary_use_case: Preventing unverified or bot accounts from joining and spamming Telegram groups.
cover_image_prompt: A friendly, stylized robot guard standing at the entrance of a vibrant Telegram group chat. The robot holds up a glowing, interactive image CAPTCHA puzzle to a shadowy, indistinct figure attempting to enter. Successfully verified users are depicted as bright, clear avatars passing through the entrance, while failed attempts are shown as fading, glitching figures being gently pushed away. Subtle digital particles and code snippets float around the robot, indicating its automated nature. The overall mood is welcoming yet secure, with a clean, modern illustration style and a bright color palette.
